content.question: If g is a differentiable function such that <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>h</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mi>g</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>=</mo> <mi>x</mi> </mrow> <annotation>MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaaeaaaaaaaaa8 qacaWGObWdamaabmaabaWdbiaadEgapaWaaeWaaeaapeGaamiEaaWd aiaawIcacaGLPaaaaiaawIcacaGLPaaapeGaaeiiaiabg2da9iaabc cacaWG4bGaaeiiaaaa@4047@</annotation> </semantics> </math> for all x, what is the value of <math> <semantics> <mrow> <msup> <mi>g</mi> <mo>'</mo> </msup> <mo>(</mo> <mn>7</mn> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <annotation>MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaaeaaaaaaaaa8 qacaWGNbGaai4ja8aadaqadaqaa8qacaaI3aaapaGaayjkaiaawMca aaaa@3A25@</annotation> </semantics> </math> ?

unit.text: 3: Differentiation: Composite, Implicit, and Inverse Functions

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the classification of a given expression (e.g., Use the chain rule to find the derivative of a composite function).
